The top issue for my constituents (and for me) since I took office has been climate change. We got so many climate-friendly provisions into the CHIPS and Science Act, it's less well known than the infrastructure law and IRA but it's a great climate bill 8/

At the time we passed the bill, I chaired the House Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics, and was thrilled when we were able to finally write and pass the first bipartisan reauthorization of NASA in years 7/

This bill has investments and authorizations that will benefit American communities for many years to come, but we don't have to wait: we're seeing the jobs boom right now. 4/

The CHIPS and Science Act has been very successful in spurring American manufacturing, a core interest for job creation and economic growth, and strengthening our supply chains, which also has national security implications. 3/

The CHIPS and Science Act was created by combining two big bipartisan, bicameral legislative pushes: a bill to reauthorize and support US scientific and research agencies, and an effort to spur manufacturing and economic competitiveness with other countries (especially China). 2/

One year ago I looked on as President Biden signed the bipartisan CHIPS and Science Act into law.

If you’re driving towards a cliff, you don't step on the gas and make plans to go over the edge.

You turn away from the cliff!

The debt limit is a cliff, and debt prioritization is a plan to take us over the edge. Let's just avoid going over the cliff by raising the debt limit!

A default means millions of jobs lost, a global recession, huge costs for average people.

The top risk of this bill is if Republicans actually believe it would prevent a default. It 100% would not.

But if they wrongly think it does they'll be more likely to allow a default.

This is common sense.

If someone asks you for money, you want to know they'll pay you back. If you see them fail to pay someone back, you will be less likely to loan them money.

If investors sees US debts as unsafe, it will cause a financial panic like the 2008 crash. Moody's:

We know because 12 years ago credit rating agencies downgraded our credit over Republican debt limit brinkmanship.

This credit downgrade cost the U.S. billions of dollars, it drove up borrowing costs for regular people. It could happen again. That's more money on your mortgage.

The perception that American bonds are the safest investment underpins the global economy.

If we fail to pay what we owe, it won't matter if it was a bond holder or our troops: it will demonstrate that we aren't good for our debts, and investors *will* react to that information.

Vital securities underpinning the entire global financial system are pegged to American Treasury bonds.

The global financial system is literally built on the full faith and credit of the United States government, on the fact that we are good for our debts and pay on time.

And most importantly, economic.

If we breach the debt limit and the Republican law causes Chinese bondholders to get paid while American schools and hospitals don't, that is a default on our debt!

The United States owes money it promised to pay, and it didn't make the payment.

Legal: the payments Treasury makes are legal obligations passed by Congress. If some people get paid and others don't, many of those who don't get paid will file lawsuits.

This is just common sense to most of us if you think about it for a minute. cbsnews.com/news/the-u-s-has…

And I need to keep repeating: this *won't work*. It will NOT prevent a default on our debt.

There are several reasons why it can't prevent a default--

Logistical: Treasury handles an enormous number of payments every day, they aren't set up to pick and choose individual basis.

The Republican bill prioritizes paying Chinese debt-holders above payments for American schools and hospitals, our seniors who depend on Medicaid, over our police, over our border security, over anyone who works on homeland security or counterterrorism or federal law enforcement.

Which bills does Republicans' legislation prioritize?

First, payments to holders of our public debt, much of which is held in China.

In fact, the Republican bill prioritizes those Chinese debt holders above paying our troops. our veteran benefits, our national defense. Really.

If we breach the debt limit, Treasury won't be able to borrow, payments owed will be greater than revenue coming in, and some will go unpaid.

A default on the faith and credit of the United States.

The GOP bill tells Treasury to pay some bills before others. Still a default.

The US government spends money every day as directed by Congress on many things. Big ticket items include Social Security, Medicare, veterans benefits, defense, and payments on our public debt.

Meanwhile, the US Treasury takes in money (revenue) every day- taxes, customs, etc.

Let me be as clear as possible: "debt prioritization" will not work. It will not do what they says it does. It will not prevent a default.

The Republicans won't tell you this and I worry more and more that they don't even understand it themselves, so let me explain it here.

This morning Republicans on the House Ways and Means Committee are making the House GOP's first major move on the debt limit: holding a markup to advance a bill to "prioritize debt" in the event of a debt limit breach.

This bill is a plan *to default* and cause a recession.
Self-governance and autonomy are fundamental American values, basic rights which Washingtonians deserve. Washington, D.C. should be a state.

The defense of our country is not a "Tier II obligation."

The Republicans' plan to default on America's debt prioritizes paying bondholders in China over paying our troops and our veterans' benefits. 

And it would wreck our economy.
